span.br:
Support our local high school seniors by turning on your porch light in sync with your school's stadium lights at 8:20 p.m. (20:20 military time).
You should leave your light on for 20 minutes and 20 seconds for Mazama, Gilchrist, and Chiloquin.
Lost River and Bonanza are leaving their lights on for one minute for every graduating senior -- 41 minutes for Lost River and 27 minutes for Bonanza. Henley High School will light up its tennis courts from 7:15 p.m. to 10 p.m. -- one minute for each of the school's 164 seniors.
Henley, Lost River, and Bonanza are turning their lights on every school night (M-F). Mazama is lighting up its stadium on Fridays, and Chiloquin on Wednesdays. Gilchrist doesn't have stadium lights but encourages the community to turn their porch lights in support.

div.h2: Help Desk for Chromebook internet issues

div.style: margin: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 12px; font-family: Roboto, "Lucida Grande", arial, sans-serif; line-height: 1.55; font-size: 14px; overflow-wrap: break-word; color: rgb(102, 102, 102); background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);
div.p: The school district has set up a Help Desk for families who are having issues with connecting their Chromebooks to the internet. If you have a connectivity issue, please contact the Help Desk at 541-851-8735 between 9 a.m. and 5 p.m. Please note: The Help Desk is for Chromebook internet issues only. For issues with assignments and software, please contact your school.

h2.style: margin-right: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px; margin-left: 0px; padding: 5px 0px 10px; font-size: 25px; font-weight: 400; line-height: 1em; overflow-wrap: break-word; color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: sm_futura-nn, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; letter-spacing: -1px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);

div.style: margin: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 12px; font-family: Roboto, "Lucida Grande", arial, sans-serif; line-height: 1.55; font-size: 14px; overflow-wrap: break-word; color: rgb(102, 102, 102); background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);
div.p: The Oregon Department of Education has released guidance for districts regarding seniors and graduation requirements. Click Graduation Pathways 2020 to read the full document. KCSD parents or their student will receive a call from their school guidance office in the next two weeks to discuss their specific situation. Seniors who were on track for graduation as of March 12 will receive their diplomas. More information will follow regarding graduation celebrations in June.

hr.p: You can help us by communicating any issues and concerns. Please send suggestions to kcsd_covid19@kcsd.k12.or.us. You may also leave a message for us on our hotline at 541-851-8744.

div.span: Report Bullying, harassment or intimidation at your school.

The Klamath County School District does not discriminate on the basis of age, citizenship, color, disability, gender expression, gender identity, national origin, parental or marital status, race, religion, sex, or sexual orientation in its programs and activities, and provides equal access to designated youth groups. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding discrimination:

Mark Greif, Director, Human Resources
greifm@kcsd.k12.or.us
phone 541-851-8753
